'''''Arda Philology 6''''' is the sixth volume of the journal ''[[Arda (annual)|Arda Philology]]'', and contains the proceedings of the Sixth International Conference on Tolkien's Invented Languages, ''[https://www.omentielva.com/oenquea.htm Omentielva Enquea] ([[Omentielva]])'', which was held in Jenins, Switzerland, in August [[2015]].<center>[[Arda Philology 5|Previous Issue]] || '''[[Arda Philology 7|Next Issue]]''' </center>

==Contents==
*Foreword
*Contents
*Contributors' Biographies
*Index Locorum
*[[Chris Gilson]]: "The Role of [[Solosimpilin]] in the Creation of [[Qenya]]"
*Tsukusu Jinn Itó: "The Shaping of Middle-mouth: A Theory of the Representation of Consonantal Phonetic Features in the Feanorian Tengwar"
*Miriam Mayburd: "Cognitive Constellations between Medieval and Modern: The Emergence of Language as Play in Tolkien‘s Written Wor(l)d"
*Bertrand Bellet: "Months and Seasons in Middle-earth"

==External links==
*[https://www.omentielva.com/ardaph6.htm Arda Philology Volume 6]
